revised_title: Amendment to the Theory of Ferromagnetic Induction and a New Model
tldr: The author proposes an amendment to the theory of ferromagnetic induction and presents a new model to explain the behavior of ferromagnetic substances. The model demonstrates how hysteresis occurs when magnetic elements within atoms break away from one stable position to another, and how external factors like impurities, strain, and temperature affect the magnetic properties of materials. This new model aligns with observed phenomena in iron and other ferromagnetic substances.
